subtasks: Measure sunflower height**: Measure the height of the sunflower from the base to the middle of the head.
Remove sunflower head**: Carefully remove the sunflower head, using scissors if necessary.
Check seed maturity**: Ensure the sunflower seeds are mature (black and fully developed) before proceeding.
Count spirals in seed head**: Count the number of seed spirals in two directions (clockwise and counterclockwise) using the sunflower head.
Start from the center and count outward spirals clockwise.
Identify and count spirals in the opposite direction (counterclockwise).
Alternatively, take a photo of the seed head and use image editing software to count spirals accurately.
Verify Fibonacci sequence**: Confirm if the number of spirals follows the Fibonacci sequence, which often appears in mature sunflowers.
